name: Beaches Negril Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I read the reviews before I booked- thank you very much all who recommended the 600 block of rooms, and the bug spray. Now I see the widely varying reviews from the people who were there around the same time as us- we arrived the Saturday after Thanksgiving for a week.
reviews.title: Why the reviews vary...

reviews.text: The first night we were put into room 807, a "honeymoon deluxe with garden view"- and hell. There was no stopper for the drain in the tub so I could not take a bath, the room was small and dark and depressing, the grout in the bathroom was stained, the entire 800 block faces the kitchen's "extractor" a very noisy constant droning hum sucking the heat out of the kitchen- inescapable in the room because the bathroom door and window facing it are slatted. I read the "Sunny Times", the daily newsletter that tells you where and when you can eat and what you can do that day, and see that every restaurant requires "no sleeveless shirts" at dinner. All I brought was "spaghetti strap" t's. I had traveled all day with my 3 year old only to arrive at a place where I could not bathe, sleep or eat.
reviews.title: Nice But Big Minuses

reviews.text: This same manager mentioned just before me in two reviews, Roger, was in charge and he literally drove me to tears. I was sobbing. While the staff worked hard to fix the tub (had to actually change the drain, not just supply a stopper), Roger told me I was lucky to have been "upgraded" to this room, as the category I had booked was actually facing a busy road. (I see that in an earlier review as well, someone unfortunate not to be "upgraded" to the room with the droning extractor noise, left with the noisy road). Roger also sniffed at me that I should have read the hotel information about their fancy restaurants and dress code. He dragged a server from the restaurant to the room to view my clothes to see if they were appropriate. He was just awful. He said he had arranged for the extractor to be turned off at 10:30, but it never went off.
reviews.title: Mixed Review From A Returning Guest

reviews.text: The next day, a manager named Sadik was in charge and said a room had become available in the 600 block. When I saw it I thought I was at another hotel. This was a totally gorgeous room, twice the size, facing the sea, next to the main restaurant and pool. I woke my son out of a deep nap to move there- fast. Sadik is my hero.
reviews.title: Had fun with family but would go elsewhere next time!

reviews.text: And the dress code at the restaurants was more horsepucky. When I went to the Italian restaurant- "Seville" to take my food away, as I was not dressed nicely enough according to Roger to stay and eat, and hadn't reservations, I saw all manner of clothing, and the manager at the restaurant told me I was dressed fine to eat there.
reviews.title: Poor Service by Management

reviews.text: Had the most amazing 10 days. The staff were excellent with my 22month old Harry. He loved given high fives and respect. We sat on the beach everyday by the bar and Ned and Leggon could not have done any more for us. Excellent guys. Jermaine was also a star with Harry. I want to go back again and again. Xxx
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Hello. I'm Alex. I'm young- only in ninth grade. I've been all over the world. Out of all the Beaches resorts, I've been too them all, Negril is the best.
reviews.title: A Seriously Great Time

reviews.text: Beaches Turks & Caicos- It was a gorgeous resort. The rooms were huge, the entertainment was spot on, and the food (Bobby Dee's) was very good. The problem was that everything was so far away! You'd have to walk a mile to get to the beach. The beach was beautiful, of course, but it was tiny. The ocean was always too windy to go in. The staff was rude and inconsiderate and I didn't like the lack of water sports.
reviews.title: A family friendly resort with something for everyone

reviews.text: Beaches Boboscel- It was pretty, but tiny. There weren't many places to eat and the food was B.A.D. The rooms smelled like poo, and the doors had mold. Stank-ee! Also, the beach had sticks in it and the jellyfish were terrible. It was one gigantic cliff too.
reviews.title: Beautful Resort for Families

reviews.text: Beaches Sandy Bay- Smelly, small, no restaraunts, moldy, pools had poop at the bottom, do I need to go on?
reviews.title: Pretty Hotel....the Worst Food!

reviews.text: Our first Caribbean experience could not have been better. We arrived in the evening to a beautiful sunset, clear turquoise water, and sandy beaches. Everything was made so easy and our three year old was treated with genuine kindness by everyone. The friendly smiling staff made us feel at ease and the grounds and rooms were very beautiful and peaceful. The food was very good and the bars on the beach were definitely enjoyed. We felt so comfortable our son stayed in Kids Camp while we went on a sunset cruise which was just amazing. We plan on returning in the next year or two and bringing our toddler and teen. This time we may explore a bit more but relaxing on the beach was fine with us.
reviews.title: Super relaxing family vacation at Beaches Negril

reviews.text: Our best vacation yet. Yes, the beach, the food, the accomodations were fantastic, but it was the people at Beaches who made our trip increadible. Genuine hospitality. It was like visiting family. The kitchen staff, the wait staff, Butler Beach and Gym staff were amazing. Our kids loved the food options (pizza, hot dogs, hamburgers, and the self serve ice cream bar), a kids paradise. For aduIt, food options were also amazing and delicious. Dinner on the beach, nice! Bravo Beaches. Thanks to Conray, Garfield, Novia, Vanessa. We look forward to our next visit! Pierre
reviews.title: Family Friendly - Best Vacation ever

reviews.text: I have had the best vacation ever at Beaches Negril. I teach customer service so I see all kinds of service out there but this was exceptional.
reviews.title: Another great family vacation at Beaches Negril!!

reviews.text: I have an anaphylactic food allergy (sulphites – a preservative they use in a wide variety of foods like corn starch, baking powder, vinegars, lemon juice concentrate etc.). The Executive Chef and 2 of his sous chefs met with me the first day to discuss my “special” food needs. Conray (a sous – chef dedicated to help out with food allergies) went above and beyond to ensure my food was safe for me to eat. He stayed late and designed recipes which he then had typed up for me so I could have them at home.
reviews.title: Nice family resort, but overall average service and food

reviews.text: The most memorable event of our trip was a dinner at the Kimono restaurant. Our cook, Mickedo sang while he cooked and his "show" was the best at the resort. Our kids had so much fun they wanted to stay for another meal just to continue the show. The entire staff that took care of us that night, Dahlia, Jason, Koyalin, and Monique) were fun and entertaining as well as outstanding at their job. The resort was obviously designed for families with children. The kids area is setup so that from one central area they have access to food, soda, sweets, water park, basketball, and the beach. The resort inclusions are numerous, in great working order, and well organized. There are enough activities at the resort to keep kids of any age busy for many days.
reviews.title: Great Resort - Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: We just returned from beaches Negril (dec 16-23). We have four boys, ages 1, twin 3 year olds and a 13 year old. This was our first trip to an all inclusive so I don't have allot to compare to but overall we had a great week. The staff were so friendly and so good to our children, often helping us out at meal times when the kids were being a handful. The staff in general are warm, caring and accommodating. The resort met all of our expectations and the beach is amazing. The beach cabanas are well worth the extra cost if you have young children. There is a wide variety of food and mostly it was very good, you will never go hungry. Drinks are excellent, no skimping on liquor. We felt very safe letting our thirteen year old wander the resort, very safe and lots of security. Evening entertainment was usually great family shows, the kids loved seeing the sesame street crew. The Thursday night beach party was a great way to spend our last night.
reviews.title: "awesome staff, awesome beach, great for young children!"

reviews.text: Our complaints are few but, the resort was busy and restaurant reservations and snorkeling reservations were hard to get, you had better be in line at 8am. Gift shop was expensive so bring all your children's beach toys from home. Bring some cash as there is no ATM on site, going downtown is a pain. It is really nice that no tipping is allowed, you don't have to carry any money on you.
reviews.title: beaches negril

reviews.text: All in all, we would go back, the staff were great and treated us and most importantly our kids like gold!
reviews.title: Beaches vs. Club Med

reviews.text: The beautiful beaches and waters were outstanding. The staff are so friendly, it was very relaxing. The dive shop/ water sports were excellent, we spent most of our time here. Julian and Craig were both fantastic with our boys, 11 & 13 as this was their first dive. The reef is beautiful, the water is warm the atmosphere is calm. The security on the beach is great, you really are not pestered, an occasional "jet ski, mon?", is about it. A simple "no thank you" and they are gone. The beach is never crowded, I don't understand why people come to such a beautiful place to hang out at the pool, but they do. If you want to relax and watch the waves roll in and the sun go down, this is it. My only negative was there isn't alot for the adults to do after the sun goes down, but by then you are pretty tired anyway.
reviews.title: very nice resort with great staff and service attitude

description: •Located on the widest stretch of Negril's seven mile white sand beach•Stay at one, play at two with full exchange privileges with Beaches Sandy Bay including a choice of 11 dining options•“Pirates Island” Water Theme Park with 4 slides, meandering “lazy” river and splash deck•Caribbean Adventure with Sesame Street themed activities with daily character appearances, parades and stage shows•Kids Kamp & Nursery with wide range of supervised activities•Interactive Teens Program with “Trench Town” Teen's Center and Teens' Coordinator to coordinate teen activities•Expansive Two & Three Bedroom Butler serviced suites•Supervised Xbox® Play Lounge with flat screen plasma TV's & Xbox® 360 game consoles•Beaches Resorts were voted “World's Leading Family All-Inclusive 14 years in a row•Five Star Diamond Award, American Academy of Hospitality Sciences•Six Star Diamond Award, Beaches Resorts – Keeping it Green•EarthCheck Platinum Certified
